intro: Sibbaldia omeiensis, commonly known as the Omei sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, demonstrating adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, which helps reduce water loss in arid conditions. Sibbaldia omeiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
